alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Botetourt; Roanoke; Rockbridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN ROANOKE...SOUTHWESTERN ROCKBRIDGE...NORTHWESTERN BEDFORD AND CENTRAL BOTETOURT COUNTIES AND THE NORTHEASTERN CITY OF ROANOKE THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lithia, or near Montvale, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Bedford... Buchanan... Glasgow... Troutville... Montvale... and Eagle Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
